title.rendered: 15 Best Things To Do In Boston

content.rendered:
Whether or not you’re a fan of Infinite Jest, something’s drawn you to Boston that you can’t really describe. And now you’ve started to find rooms for rent in Boston, or maybe you’ve already found your new home, or maybe you’re just visiting. Whatever the reason, now that you’re here, you need to know about all the best things to do in Boston. So let’s get to the deep crooks of ‘Beantown’ and make a list of super cool things to do in Boston.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Boston

Go outside

1. The Charles River Esplanade

spottedbylocals.com

When looking for the best things to do in Boston, head to the 17 mile stretch of land along the Charles river banks: the Esplanade. With beautiful paths that people use for walking, jogging, rollerblading, biking, you can just sit around soaking in some sun on the grass. This is one of the places to visit in Boston that you must visit for a relaxing day out.

Costs: Free

Timings: Open 24*7

Event calendar
Guided tours

2. Fenway victory gardens

nationalgeographic.org

Gardeners, rejoice! The Fenway Victory Gardens holds the purpose of maintaining and encouraging urban gardening for the benefit of all residents of Boston. So when looking for the best things to do in Boston when you live here, you can grow fresh vegetables, herbs, flowers, and more with the many workshops and communities at this beautiful gem of Boston tourism.

Membership Fee: $40 per plot

Timings: 06:00 am – 11:00 pm

Visit the website
Get membership

3. Boston Harbor Cruises – Whale Watching

timeout.com

When looking for seriously cool things to do in Boston, hop onto the high-speed catamaran vessels to experience a three-hour whale watch cruise with the Boston Harbor Cruises. The cruise offers a climate-controlled cabin, tables, and food.

Costs: $34 – $37 per person

Timings: 07:00 am – 08:00 pm

Visit the website
Buy tickets

Enjoy sports

4. Baseball & Tours at Fenway Park

ballparksofbaseball.com

If you’re a baseball fan, Fenway Park should be on your list of places to visit in Boston. Home to the American League baseball team, Boston Red Sox, you can head here to enjoy baseball matches, Boston style, or enjoy a public tour of the place.

Costs: Varies with the event and seating area. Check detailed costs here.

Timings: 09:00 am – 05:00 pm

Buy tickets
Check schedule

5. Basketball, Hockey & Sports Museum at TD Garden

tripadvisor.com

The sports museum is one of the best places to visit in Boston if you like sports. Along with being a museum with exhibits celebrating sports in the area, it also provides character-building, transformative educational programs that positively impact at-risk kids in the area through sports culture.

Costs: Public tours: $15/person

Private tours: $30/person

Event calendar
Visit the website

6. Boston Marathon

nytimes.com

One of the things to do in Boston, you can enter, volunteer, or watch the Boston Marathon with family or friends. An annual marathon inspired by the first marathon in 1896, it is traditionally held on the third Monday of April every year.

Watch spots
Qualifications to enter

Explore museums

7. Harvard Museum of Natural History

hmnh.harvard.edu

With a mission to enhance public understanding and appreciation of the natural world, this is truly one of the best places to visit in Boston to celebrate the spirit of curiosity and discovery inherent in our species.

Costs: $15.00

Timings: 09:00 am – 05:00 pm

Visit the website
Exhibitions on display

8. Museum of African American History

bostonmagazine.com

The largest museum that preserves, conserves, and interprets the contribution of African Americans, the Boston branch preserves two historic sites and two Black heritage trails that tell the story of the past culture of the black communities. You can discover exhibits, programs, and educational activities as some of the best things to do in Boston.

Costs: Free entry

Timings: Monday – Friday: 10:00 am – 4:00 pm

Exhibitions on display

9. John F. Kennedy Presidential Library And Museum

wikipedia.com

Preserving the vision of seeking a better world through politics, the JFK library and museum is one of the best places to visit in Boston. Located in a ten-acre park overlooking the sea, the museum offers tours on his life and work and the library can be used by students and scholars for research.

Costs: $9.50 – $13.25

Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM

Exhibits on display

Experience the culture

10. Boston Public Library

bostonusa.com

The first large free municipal library in the country, a majestic reading room, Bates hall awaits you at the Boston public library. Stunning architecture and an amazing collection, this is one of the best things to do in Boston if your idea of vacation is traveling through books.

Costs: Free

Timings: Monday – Thursday: 10:00 am – 06:00 pm | Friday & Saturday: 10:00 am – 04:00 pm

Sunday: Closed

Event calendar

11. Brattle Book shop

cntraveler.com

One of the largest antiquarian book shops in the country owned by the Gloss family, this one’s a wonderful place to visit in Boston. With a stock of over 250,000 books, maps, prints, postcards, and more, it also is home to first editions, collectibles, and antique items.

Timings: Monday – Saturday: 09:00 am – 05:30 pm

Event calendar
Visit the website

12. Harvard Square

harvardmagazine.com

When looking for cool things to do, look no further than Harvard square. A place of history, books, ideas, and learning, this is one place you must add to your list of places to visit in Boston. Home to bookstores, coffee houses, shopping spots, theaters, music, and more, you can also stay here when you visit.

Costs: Free entry

Timings: 24*7

Event calendar
Book your stay

Eat, drink and shop

13. Faneuil Hall Marketplace

bostonusa.com

A site of meetings, protests and debates, and many recreation spots, Faneuil Hall is a must on your list of places to visit in Boston for a taste of Boston culture and American liberty in its best form.

Costs: Entry free

Timings: 10:00 am – 07:00 pm

History

14. The Baldwin Bar

baldwinbar.com

The Baldwin bar is one of the justified entries in Esquire’s 2017 list of best bars in America! And our opinion is, that a ‘cool things to do in Boston’ list would be incomplete without the Baldwin bar.

And Bostonian Luke O’Neil’s description of the bar for Boston magazine makes it more convincing!

Picture the best Chinese-takeout restaurant you’ve been to: dumplings and thick-cut bacon in garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppers. Now put that inside a New England Colonial mansion built in 1661. When you tack on one of the best cocktail bars in Massachusetts, it’s almost an embarrassment of riches… Cocktails come in meticulously stage-dressed vessels: brown and bitter recipes in flasks served in cigar boxes, or a glass egg filled with Aperol, absinthe, and grapefruit served on a bed of flowers.

Timings: Sunday – Thursday: 05:00 pm – 09:30 am | Friday & Saturday: 05:00 pm – 11:00 am

See menu
Make a reservation

15. Tatte Bakery & Cafe

bostonmagazine.com

And ending on a sweet spot, this is one of the best places to visit in Boston to experience the sweetness of the city. Founder Tzurit Or wanted Tatte to be a place for the community to gather, to feel welcomed, to create a sense of home and belonging. Now she has 18 bakeries in Boston and Washington, with the original intention staying intact.

Timings: 07:00 am – 08:00 pm

Order in
See menu

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find things to do in Boston? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Houses for Rent in Boston in Higher Demand Than Ever
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Alright, so Boston is an expensive place to live. Where isn’t these days (besides Texas)? Prices on apartments and houses for rent in Boston increased by nearly 6 percent in 2015. Much to the dismay of students and young professionals, Boston is just one of the many metros where neither…

img.alt_text: Apartments for rent in Boston at Acorn street

jetpack-related-posts.title: 5 Reasons to Move to Boston
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Looking to move to a vibrant new city? Boston could be the perfect place for you! Now, there are a lot of advantages of living in Boston. Located in New England on the coast of Massachusetts, the city is home to rich culture and opportunities. But that's just one of…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Find Rooms For Rent In Cape Cod
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: If quaint villages, seafood shacks, lighthouses, ponds, bay and ocean beaches pique your interest then you’ve come to the right place! Cape Cod, a hook-shaped peninsula of the U.S. state of Massachusetts, is a popular summertime destination. But what if this summertime vacation could be 365 days? Amazing, right! We’ll…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Find Rooms For Rent In Salem
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Located in Essex County on Massachusetts’ North Shore, Salem is a city full of rich history and culture. The “Witch City” is full of historic charm from its architectural wonders to its literary legends. The city also has lots of clubs and activities to get involved in, especially if you’re a…

jetpack-related-posts.title: The Best Activities to do in Boston During the Winter
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Grab your winter coat and get wrapped up! Whether you live in Boston or you're visiting for a weekend, there’s plenty of fun activities to do despite the freezing temperatures. From ice skating on the Boston Common to shopping downtown, there's always something to do to keep you occupied. Better…
